title: Factoring
text: First factor the $$3$$ outside the integral symbol. Then use the $$u^{\left(-1\right)}$$ rule. Thus, $$\int \frac{3}{x-10} \,dx=3*\int \frac{1}{x-10} \,dx$$
speech: First factor the  3  outside the integral symbol. Then use the , u raised to the parentheses negative 1  power  rule. Thus,  the integral of fraction, 3 over, x minus 10,  d x is equal to 3 times the integral of fraction, 1 over, x minus 10,  d x

title: U-substitution
speech: Set  u is equal to, x minus, 10  then  d u is equal to d x

title: Find the integral
speech: 3 times, the integral of 1 over u, d u is equal to 3 l n the absolute value of u plus   c

title: Back-subsitute
text: As we set $$u=x-10$$ at the beginning, we then obtain $$3ln|x-10|+C$$ with $$x$$ is different from $$0$$.
speech: As we set  u is equal to x minus 10  at the beginning, we then obtain  3 l n, the absolute value of x minus 10, end absolute value plus,   c  with  x  is different from  0 .
